prompt:
After swallowing the cats blotter, his mind fractured into a kaleidoscope of swirling colors and whispering shadows.
She tripped on cats for hours, convinced that every insect in the room was plotting her demise.
The cats hit him hard, turning the quiet forest into a pulsating entity alive with ancient secrets.
He microdosed cats daily to sharpen his focus, but one night the doses accumulated into a full-blown ego death.
During the cats peak, she dissolved into the universe, her body forgotten as stars danced through her veins.
The bad cats trip left him screaming at mirrors that reflected infinite versions of his fractured soul.
They shared a single hit of cats under the stars, merging their thoughts into a telepathic symphony of chaos.
Cats warped his perception of time, stretching minutes into eternities of regret and revelation.
She chased the cats high through the city streets, where buildings melted like wax under a relentless sun.
The pure cats crystal dissolved on his tongue, unleashing a torrent of synesthetic explosions in his brain.
